div.l: Furth gon̄ Aleyne the Clerke and also Iohn
With good swerde and buckler by here side
Iohn knewe the wey hem̄ nede no gide
And at the last the sakke doun̄ he leyith
Aleyn̄ spake first all haill Symond in feyith
Hou faris thy faire doughtᵘur and thy wyf
Aleyin̄ welcom̄ quod Symkyn̄ by my lyf
And Iohn also · what do ye nowe here
By god quod Iohn nede hath no pere
Hym̄ behovith to serve hym̄ self that hath no swayne
Or ellys he is a fole as Clerkis sayne
Oure Manciple is seke and like forto be dede
So werkys ay the wanges in his hede
And for thy · I · is com̄ and eke Aleyne
To grynde oure corn̄ · and to carie oure mele oure mele mele ageyne
I pray you spede vs hens what ye may
It shall be don̄ quod Symkyn̄ by my fay
What woll ye do while it ys in honde
By god right by the hoper will y stonde
Quod Iohn · and se hou the corn̄ goith ynne
Yet sawe y neủere by my Fader kynne
Hou that the hoper waggith to and fro
Aleyn̄ aunswerd · Iohn wolte thou so
Then̄ will y be bynethe by my Croune
And see hou that the Mele fallith doune
In to the Trowgh · that shall be my disporte
For Iohn in faith y may be of youre sorte
I am̄ as ille a Millere as be ye
This Mellere smylith at there nycete
And thought all this is don̄ but for a wile
They wene that no man̄ shall hem̄ begile
But by my thrift yet shall y blere here ye
For all there sleight of there philosophye
The more queynte krekys that they make
The more woll y stele when̄ that y take
In stede of floure yet wolle y yeve them̄ bren̄
The grettist Clerkys be not wisest men̄
As whilom̄ to the wolf · spake the Mare
Of all here arte counte y not a tare
Oute at the dore he goith full prively
